jsx.dom.query
Class Query

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.dom.query.Query

public final class Query
extends Disposable

A utility class supporting DOM query with its static methods.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Method Detail

getElementsByTagName

public static final ArrayLike<JsNode> getElementsByTagName(JsElement ctx,
                                                           java.lang.String name,
                                                           Selector sel)

Returns an array of all JsElement nodes in the current document that have the specified tag name by traversing all descendants of this element and are selected against the given Selector object.

Parameters:
ctx - The current element.
name - The tag name of the desired elements.
sel - A Selector object.
Returns:
An array of result nodes.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
getElementsByTagName(String), getElementsByTagName(JsElement, String), getElementsByTagName(String, Selector), Nodes.getElementsByTagName(JsNode, String)

                                                  Selector sel)

Parameters:

An array of result nodes.

createExpression

public static final JsObject createExpression(java.lang.String xpath)

Creates a new XPath expression object that represents a compiled XPath query.

This method tries to eliminate browser dependencies.

Parameters:
xpath - The string representing the XPath expression to compile.
Returns:
A newly created XPath expression object.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsDocument.createExpression(String), selectNodes(JsObject, JsNode), selectNodes(JsObject)

selectNodes

public static final ArrayLike<JsNode> selectNodes(JsObject expr)

Performs an XPath query using the current document as the root and returns the result as an array of nodes.

This method tries to eliminate browser dependencies.

Parameters:
expr - A compiled XPath expression object.
Returns:
The query result as an array of nodes.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
selectNodes(JsObject, JsNode), createExpression(String), JsNode.selectNodes(String)

selectNodes

public static final ArrayLike<JsNode> selectNodes(JsObject expr,
                                                  JsNode ctx)

Performs an XPath query using the given node as the root and returns the result as an array of nodes.

This method tries to eliminate browser dependencies.

Parameters:
expr - A compiled XPath expression object.
ctx - The root node.
Returns:
The query result as an array of nodes.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
selectNodes(JsObject), createExpression(String), JsNode.selectNodes(String)
